oai_dc:dc.dc:description: On envelope: ''#618 Cohen, Joe of Fairplay ca 1890.'' On photograph: ''#618, Cohen's of Fairplay, Joe Cohen 2nd from top left, Gus & Louis Cohen bottom center, ca. 1890.'' On the front of the photo everyone is identified; however, some names have been cut off.

Fairplay baseball team pose with equipment. Back row left to right: [illegible] Wilson, Joe Cohen, A.A. Dollison, Bill Anderson, Wilson. Middle row left to right: Joe Summers, Martin, William Hill, Bob Foote, Buster Clark. Front row left to right: Verne Clark, Gus Cohen, Louis Cohen, and an unidentified men [names cut off at bottom of print].

Denver (Colo.)
Colfax Avenue (Denver, Colo.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Typed note in envelope: ''COLFAX SCHOOL GRADUATING CLASS, JANUARY 1950; Bottom Row, left to right; Howard Emeson, Ronald Handler, Fred Speyer, Sherman Opper, Roberta Simon; Second Row; Egan Hansen (Principal), Avrum Rubin, Victor Heackley, Jack Zelkin, Larry Pettis, Marcia McCammon (Teacher); Third Row; Beryle Saliman, Ralph Pitter, Paul Cohen; Top Row; Donald Handler, Ila Rose Blumberg, Bill Litvak, Gail Turner.'' Written on the front of the photograph: ''Colfax School 6A - class Jan. 1950.''

Group school portrait of the graduating class of Colfax Elementary School in 1950. Bottom row, from left to right: Howard Emeson, Ronald Handler, Fred Speyer, Sherman Opper, Roberta Simon. Second row, from left to right: Egan Hansen (Principal), Avrum Rubin, Victor Heackley, Jack Zelkin, Larry Pettis, and Marcia McCammon (Teacher). Third row, from left to right: Beryle Saliman, Ralph Pitter, and Paul Cohen. Top row, from left to right: Donald Handler, Ila Rose Blumberg, Bill Litvak, and Gail Turner.
oai_dc:dc.dc:format: 1 item (photograph), 8 x 10 inches, black and white
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: Copyright restrictions may apply. User is responsible for all copyright compliance.

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: On envelope: ''#102 Fourth of July, Aspen, 1914'' Handwritten on back of photograph: ''#102 Fourth of July Aspen 1914 donated by: Silas Kobey.''

Fourth of July Celebration in Aspen, Colorado. An unidentified woman is standing outside on a wooden stage. A large American flag is strung up at the back of the stage, between two trees. A crowd of people is circled around the stage and a band is playing.

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Printed on the front of the photograph: ''E.D.H.S. Class of 1907, photo by CL McClure.'' Handwritten in pencil on the front of the photograph: ''6 from rt.'' and an arrow pointing to a circle around a male student in the sixth row. In the right front corner is handwritten ''Lewis Chernoff.'' Handwritten on the back of the photograph are names identifying the people in the photograph: ''Genevieve E. Perry, Irene Petersen, Chas. Hezmalhalah, Rowena E. McLennke, Bertha Werner, George F. Kimbrough, Earl Ellis, Baptiste Zimmermann, Earl Cree, Oscar M. Rachofsky, Arthur H. Laws, Claribel Kendall, Helen Allphin, Canton O'Donnell, Albert Bancroft, Clara P. Mohr, Florence Andrew, Anna E. Seais, Louise Allen, Edward Swift, Ruby V. Begg, Victor C. Moulton, Lula McFall, Walker M. Shaw, Florence Colby, Edna L. Reitze, Florntine Morning, Ralph S. Pitts, R. E. Quarly, Mary Stuart, Edah R. Chase, Helen T. Tuttle, Bertha Rachofsky, Jessie Hickenberger, Joe Hauly, Edna Paula Potter, Ailah Whittaker, Marie Allen, Helen Krajicek, Pearl E. Norfolk, Lettie Malinsten, Floretta Doty, Clarence Warthan, Winthrop E. Beausbard, Josephine Hepner, Fred T. Bryan, Nelle Traves, John McCarthy, Warner Mills, Isidor Rosenblum, Kast Shelton, Madeline A. Marshall, Charline A. Waters, Louise Rosenstock, Mary Miller, Arthur Zuatou, Carl McLauthlin, Carline Royal, Louise Higgins, Theodora MacAltioner, Beatrice Wozer, Earl Wettengel, William M. Parker, Harry C. Browne, Lansing Pearse, Wm. E. Dall, Gustave W. Vaelzel, Ortha B. Fielder, Otto Herres Jr., Rvd. P. Waner, Georgie Ruffe, Katherine Bartley, Peta R. Sweet, Frazer Bansko, Bertha Weiner, Rose Feldman, Florence Bruckman, Minnie Levy, Ethel M. Shoturll, Myrtle Knight, Thyrza Cohen, Jean Parker, Ida H. Quintin, Nellie P. Johnson, June Marie Barker, Charles Burnham, Walter C. Arundel, Jack Barrowsy, Marjorie B Sanway, John B. Garrie, Sam Cohen, Wm H. Smiley, Florance H. Scott, #735.''

The East High School in Denver, Colorado, class of 1907, is shown sitting and standing in ten rows on the steps leading to the entrance of East High. The boys are attired in suits and the girls in skirts and blouses. Students in the photograph who are identified on the back are: Lewis Chernoff, Genevieve E. Perry, Irene Petersen, Chas. Hezmalhalah, Rowena E. McLennke, Bertha Werner, George F. Kimbrough, Earl Ellis, Baptiste Zimmermann, Earl Cree, Oscar M. Rachofsky, Arthur H. Laws, Claribel Kendall, Helen Allphin, Canton O'Donnell, Albert Bancroft, Clara P. Mohr, Florence Andrew, Anna E. Seais, Louise Allen, Edward Swift, Ruby V. Begg, Victor C. Moulton, Lula McFall, Walker M. Shaw, Florence Colby, Edna L. Reitze, Florntine Morning, Ralph S. Pitts, R. E. Quarly, Mary Stuart, Edah R. Chase, Helen T. Tuttle, Bertha Rachofsky, Jessie Hickenberger, Joe Hauly, Edna Paula Potter, Ailah Whittaker, Marie Allen, Helen Krajicek, Pearl E. Norfolk, Lettie Malinsten, Floretta Doty, Clarence Warthan, Winthrop E. Beausbard, Josephine Hepner, Fred T. Bryan, Nelle Traves, John McCarthy, Warner Mills, Isidor Rosenblum, Kast Shelton, Madeline A. Marshall, Charline A. Waters, Louise Rosenstock, Mary Miller, Arthur Zuatou, Carl McLauthlin, Carline Royal, Louise Higgins, Theodora MacAltioner, Beatrice Wozer, Earl Wettengel, William M. Parker, Harry C. Browne, Lansing Pearse, Wm. E. Dall, Gustave W. Vaelzel, Ortha B. Fielder, Otto Herres Jr., Rvd. P. Waner, Georgie Ruffe, Katherine Bartley, Peta R. Sweet, Frazer Bansko, Bertha Weiner, Rose Feldman, Florence Bruckman, Minnie Levy, Ethel M. Shoturll, Myrtle Knight, Thyrza Cohen, Jean Parker, Ida H. Quintin, Nellie P. Johnson, June Marie Barker, Charles Burnham, Walter C. Arundel, Jack Barrowsy, Marjorie B Sanway, John B. Garrie, Sam Cohen, Wm H. Smiley, and Florance H. Scott.
The photograph was donated by Deborah Greenfield, the daughter of Lewis Chernoff, December 1984.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Jewish Graves in Leadville, Colorado
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Cemeteries
Photographs
Leadville (Colo.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Handwritten on back of photograph: ''#500, Graves in Leadville Jewish Cemetery Oc. 1980 Photographer Gay Lasher.'' On envelope: ''#500 Jewish Graves in Leadville.''

Two grave sites at an unidentified Leadville, Colorado Cemetery. The inscriptions on the headstones are a mix of Hebrew and English. These gravestones are for Anna Oliner, 1848-1916, and Herman Oliner, 1850-1911.
oai_dc:dc.dc:format: 1 item (photograph), 10 x 7 inches, black and white
oai_dc:dc.dc:language: The text on the gravestones is in Hebrew, while the text written on the back of the photograph is in English.
